headline: Citigroup Refines Funding Mix With New Preferreds And Series X Redemption
summary: Citigroup (NYSE:C) has issued a new 6.500% Fixed Rate Reset Noncumulative Preferred Stock, Series JJ. The bank plans to redeem all outstanding Series X Depositary Shares tied to its 6.300% Fixed Rate / Floating Rate Noncumulative Preferred Stock, Series X. Both actions are part of Citigroup's ongoing capital structure reshaping and funding mix adjustments. Citigroup, one of the largest global banks, relies heavily on preferred stock as a funding tool alongside deposits, bonds, and other...

headline: Financials slide is overreaction to AI disruption, says RBC's Cassidy
summary: CNBC’s “Closing Bell Overtime” team discusses the impact of AI on financials, the bull case for banks and more with Gerard Cassidy, co-head of global financials research at RBC Capital Markets.

headline: Goldman Sachs, JPMorgan, and Citigroup All Plunge Over 5% on Thursday
summary: Thursday’s market session delivered a painful reminder that even the strongest financial stocks aren’t immune to broad-based selling pressure. Goldman Sachs (NYSE:GS), JPMorgan Chase (NYSE:JPM), and Citigroup (NYSE:C) all crashed Thursday, with the selling accelerating dramatically in the final hour of trading. Goldman Sachs: Hardest Hit with 5.1% Plunge Goldman Sachs took the hardest hit, ... Goldman Sachs, JPMorgan, and Citigroup All Plunge Over 5% on Thursday

headline: How Recent Valuation Shifts Are Reframing The Sats (OB:SATS) Investment Story
summary: The recent move in Sats' fair value estimate from NOK44.33 to NOK48.75 builds on adjusted assumptions for revenue growth of 6.90% and a net profit margin of 12.23%. These shifts sit alongside a lower 9.71% discount rate, which analysts view as more in line with their updated read on the company’s long term earnings power. Stay tuned to see how you can keep on top of further changes to this narrative as new information comes through. Analyst Price Targets don't always capture the full story...

headline: Why Elior Group (ENXTPA:ELIOR) Still Draws Interest As Price Targets And Fair Value Shift
summary: Analysts have trimmed Elior Group's price target from €4.00 to €3.60, while keeping the fair value estimate anchored at €3.12 per share. With the discount rate held at 12.3% and revenue growth assumptions essentially unchanged at 3.05%, the new target reflects a recalibrated view of potential upside rather than a wholesale rethink of the company. As this updated narrative evolves, investors may wish to monitor future shifts in expectations and sentiment around the stock. Analyst Price Targets...
